intro: Mareya micrantha subsp. congolensis, commonly known as the Congo mareya, is a flowering plant native to Central and Western Africa. It belongs to the nightshade family, Solanaceae, and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically produces small, yellow or green berries that are edible but not widely cultivated. Its botanical features include hairy stems, alternate leaves, and a preference for moist, shaded environments in its natural habitat.
